264     * Private utility constructor.
265     */
266    private SiteUtil() {

268
269    /**
270     * Get string values of the message keys from the given check class.
271     *
272     * @param module class to examine.
273     * @return a set of checkstyle's module message keys.
274     * @throws MacroExecutionException if extraction of message keys fails.
275     */
276    public static Set<String> getMessageKeys(Class<?> module)
277            throws MacroExecutionException {
278        final Set<Field> messageKeyFields = getCheckMessageKeys(module);
279        // We use a TreeSet to sort the message keys alphabetically
280        final Set<String> messageKeys = new TreeSet<>();
281        for (Field field : messageKeyFields) {
282            messageKeys.add(getFieldValue(field, module).toString());
283        }
284        return messageKeys;
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * Gets the check's messages keys.
289     *
290     * @param module class to examine.
291     * @return a set of checkstyle's module message fields.
292     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the attempt to read a protected class fails.
293     * @noinspection ChainOfInstanceofChecks
294     * @noinspectionreason ChainOfInstanceofChecks - We will deal with this at
295     *                     <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/13500">13500</a>
296     *
297     */
298    private static Set<Field> getCheckMessageKeys(Class<?> module)
299            throws MacroExecutionException {
300        try {
301            final Set<Field> checkstyleMessages = new HashSet<>();
302
303            // get all fields from current class
304            final Field[] fields = module.getDeclaredFields();
305
306            for (Field field : fields) {
307                if (field.getName().startsWith("MSG_")) {
308                    checkstyleMessages.add(field);
309                }
310            }
311
312            // deep scan class through hierarchy
313            final Class<?> superModule = module.getSuperclass();
314
315            if (superModule != null) {
316                checkstyleMessages.addAll(getCheckMessageKeys(superModule));
317            }
318
319            // special cases that require additional classes
320            if (module == RegexpMultilineCheck.class) {
321                checkstyleMessages.addAll(getCheckMessageKeys(Class
322                    .forName("com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.regexp.MultilineDetector")));
323            }
324            else if (module == RegexpSinglelineCheck.class
325                    || module == RegexpSinglelineJavaCheck.class) {
326                checkstyleMessages.addAll(getCheckMessageKeys(Class
327                    .forName("com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.regexp.SinglelineDetector")));
328            }
329
330            return checkstyleMessages;
331        }
332        catch (ClassNotFoundException exc) {
333            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT, "Couldn't find class: %s",
334                    module.getName());
335            throw new MacroExecutionException(message, exc);
336        }
337    }
338
339    /**
340     * Returns the value of the given field.
341     *
342     * @param field the field.
343     * @param instance the instance of the module.
344     * @return the value of the field.
345     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the value could not be retrieved.
346     */
347    public static Object getFieldValue(Field field, Object instance)
348            throws MacroExecutionException {
349        try {
350            // required for package/private classes
351            field.trySetAccessible();
352            return field.get(instance);
353        }
354        catch (IllegalAccessException exc) {
355            throw new MacroExecutionException("Couldn't get field value", exc);
356        }
357    }
358
359    /**
360     * Returns the instance of the module with the given name.
361     *
362     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
363     * @return the instance of the module.
364     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the module could not be created.
365     */
366    public static Object getModuleInstance(String moduleName) throws MacroExecutionException {
367        final ModuleFactory factory = getPackageObjectFactory();
368        try {
369            return factory.createModule(moduleName);
370        }
371        catch (CheckstyleException exc) {
372            throw new MacroExecutionException("Couldn't find class: " + moduleName, exc);
373        }
374    }
375
376    /**
377     * Returns the default PackageObjectFactory with the default package names.
378     *
379     * @return the default PackageObjectFactory.
380     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the PackageObjectFactory cannot be created.
381     */
382    private static PackageObjectFactory getPackageObjectFactory() throws MacroExecutionException {
383        try {
384            final ClassLoader cl = ViolationMessagesMacro.class.getClassLoader();
385            final Set<String> packageNames = PackageNamesLoader.getPackageNames(cl);
386            return new PackageObjectFactory(packageNames, cl);
387        }
388        catch (CheckstyleException exc) {
389            throw new MacroExecutionException("Couldn't load checkstyle modules", exc);
390        }
391    }
392
393    /**
394     * Construct a string with a leading newline character and followed by
395     * the given amount of spaces. We use this method only to match indentation in
396     * regular xdocs and have minimal diff when parsing the templates.
397     * This method exists until
398     * <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/13426">13426</a>
399     *
400     * @param amountOfSpaces the amount of spaces to add after the newline.
401     * @return the constructed string.
402     */
403    public static String getNewlineAndIndentSpaces(int amountOfSpaces) {
404        return System.lineSeparator() + " ".repeat(amountOfSpaces);
405    }
406
407    /**
408     * Returns path to the template for the given module name or throws an exception if the
409     * template cannot be found.
410     *
411     * @param moduleName the module whose template we are looking for.
412     * @return path to the template.
413     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the template cannot be found.
414     */
415    public static Path getTemplatePath(String moduleName) throws MacroExecutionException {
416        final String fileNamePattern = ".*[\\\\/]"
417                + moduleName.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT) + "\\..*";
418        return getXdocsTemplatesFilePaths()
419            .stream()
420            .filter(path -> path.toString().matches(fileNamePattern))
421            .findFirst()
422            .orElse(null);
423    }
424
425    /**
426     * Gets xdocs template file paths. These are files ending with .xml.template.
427     * This method will be changed to gather .xml once
428     * <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/13426">#13426</a> is resolved.
429     *
430     * @return a set of xdocs template file paths.
431     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an I/O error occurs.
432     */
433    public static Set<Path> getXdocsTemplatesFilePaths() throws MacroExecutionException {
434        final Path directory = Path.of("src/site/xdoc");
435        try (Stream<Path> stream = Files.find(directory, Integer.MAX_VALUE,
436                (path, attr) -> {
437                    return attr.isRegularFile()
438                            && path.toString().endsWith(".xml.template");
439                })) {
440            return stream.collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableSet());
441        }
442        catch (IOException ioException) {
443            throw new MacroExecutionException("Failed to find xdocs templates", ioException);
444        }
445    }
446
447    /**
448     * Returns the parent module name for the given module class. Returns either
449     * "TreeWalker" or "Checker". Returns null if the module class is null.
450     *
451     * @param moduleClass the module class.
452     * @return the parent module name as a string.
453     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the parent module cannot be found.
454     */
455    public static String getParentModule(Class<?> moduleClass)
456                throws MacroExecutionException {
457        String parentModuleName = "";
458        Class<?> parentClass = moduleClass.getSuperclass();
459
460        while (parentClass != null) {
461            parentModuleName = CLASS_TO_PARENT_MODULE.get(parentClass);
462            if (parentModuleName != null) {
463                break;
464            }
465            parentClass = parentClass.getSuperclass();
466        }
467
468        // If parent class is not found, check interfaces
469        if (parentModuleName == null || parentModuleName.isEmpty()) {
470            final Class<?>[] interfaces = moduleClass.getInterfaces();
471            for (Class<?> interfaceClass : interfaces) {
472                parentModuleName = CLASS_TO_PARENT_MODULE.get(interfaceClass);
473                if (parentModuleName != null) {
474                    break;
475                }
476            }
477        }
478
479        if (parentModuleName == null || parentModuleName.isEmpty()) {
480            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT,
481                    "Failed to find parent module for %s", moduleClass.getSimpleName());
482            throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
483        }
484
485        return parentModuleName;
486    }
487
488    /**
489     * Get a set of properties for the given class that should be documented.
490     *
491     * @param clss the class to get the properties for.
492     * @param instance the instance of the module.
493     * @return a set of properties for the given class.
494     */
495    public static Set<String> getPropertiesForDocumentation(Class<?> clss, Object instance) {
496        final Set<String> properties =
497                getProperties(clss).stream()
498                    .filter(prop -> {
499                        return !isGlobalProperty(clss, prop) && !isUndocumentedProperty(clss, prop);
500                    })
501                    .collect(Collectors.toCollection(HashSet::new));
502        properties.addAll(getNonExplicitProperties(instance, clss));
503        return new TreeSet<>(properties);
504    }
505
506    /**
507     * Get the javadocs of the properties of the module. If the property is not present in the
508     * module, then the javadoc of the property from the superclass(es) is used.
509     *
510     * @param properties the properties of the module.
511     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
512     * @param modulePath the module file path.
513     * @return the javadocs of the properties of the module.
514     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
515     */
516    public static Map<String, DetailNode> getPropertiesJavadocs(Set<String> properties,
517                                                                String moduleName, Path modulePath)
518            throws MacroExecutionException {
519        // lazy initialization
520        if (SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.isEmpty()) {
521            processSuperclasses();
522        }
523
524        processModule(moduleName, modulePath);
525
526        final Map<String, DetailNode> unmodifiableJavadocs =
527                ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.getJavadocsForModuleOrProperty();
528        final Map<String, DetailNode> javadocs = new LinkedHashMap<>(unmodifiableJavadocs);
529
530        properties.forEach(property -> {
531            final DetailNode superClassPropertyJavadoc =
532                    SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.get(property);
533            if (superClassPropertyJavadoc != null) {
534                javadocs.putIfAbsent(property, superClassPropertyJavadoc);
535            }
536        });
537
538        assertAllPropertySetterJavadocsAreFound(properties, moduleName, javadocs);
539
540        return javadocs;
541    }
542
543    /**
544     * Assert that each property has a corresponding setter javadoc that is not null.
545     * 'tokens' and 'javadocTokens' are excluded from this check, because their
546     * description is different from the description of the setter.
547     *
548     * @param properties the properties of the module.
549     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
550     * @param javadocs the javadocs of the properties of the module.
551     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
552     */
553    private static void assertAllPropertySetterJavadocsAreFound(
554            Set<String> properties, String moduleName, Map<String, DetailNode> javadocs)
555            throws MacroExecutionException {
556        for (String property : properties) {
557            final boolean isDocumented = javadocs.containsKey(property)
558                   || SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.containsKey(property)
559                   || TOKENS.equals(property) || JAVADOC_TOKENS.equals(property);
560            if (!isDocumented) {
561                throw new MacroExecutionException(String.format(Locale.ROOT,
562                   "%s: Missing documentation for property '%s'. Check superclasses.",
563                        moduleName, property));
564            }
565        }
566    }
567
568    /**
569     * Collect the properties setters javadocs of the superclasses.
570     *
571     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
572     */
573    private static void processSuperclasses() throws MacroExecutionException {
574        for (Path superclassPath : MODULE_SUPER_CLASS_PATHS) {
575            final Path fileNamePath = superclassPath.getFileName();
576            if (fileNamePath == null) {
577                throw new MacroExecutionException("Invalid superclass path: " + superclassPath);
578            }
579            final String superclassName = CommonUtil.getFileNameWithoutExtension(
580                fileNamePath.toString());
581            processModule(superclassName, superclassPath);
582            final Map<String, DetailNode> superclassJavadocs =
583                ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.getJavadocsForModuleOrProperty();
584            SUPER_CLASS_PROPERTIES_JAVADOCS.putAll(superclassJavadocs);
585        }
586    }
587
588    /**
589     * Scrape the Javadocs of the class and its properties setters with
590     * ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.
591     *
592     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
593     * @param modulePath the module Path.
594     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during processing.
595     */
596    private static void processModule(String moduleName, Path modulePath)
597            throws MacroExecutionException {
598        if (!Files.isRegularFile(modulePath)) {
599            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT,
600                    "File %s is not a file. Please check the 'modulePath' property.", modulePath);
601            throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
602        }
603        ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.initialize(moduleName);
604        final Checker checker = new Checker();
605        checker.setModuleClassLoader(Checker.class.getClassLoader());
606        final DefaultConfiguration scraperCheckConfig =
607                        new DefaultConfiguration(
608                                ClassAndPropertiesSettersJavadocScraper.class.getName());
609        final DefaultConfiguration defaultConfiguration =
610                new DefaultConfiguration("configuration");
611        final DefaultConfiguration treeWalkerConfig =
612                new DefaultConfiguration(TreeWalker.class.getName());
613        defaultConfiguration.addProperty(CHARSET, StandardCharsets.UTF_8.name());
614        defaultConfiguration.addChild(treeWalkerConfig);
615        treeWalkerConfig.addChild(scraperCheckConfig);
616        try {
617            checker.configure(defaultConfiguration);
618            final List<File> filesToProcess = List.of(modulePath.toFile());
619            checker.process(filesToProcess);
620            checker.destroy();
621        }
622        catch (CheckstyleException checkstyleException) {
623            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT, "Failed processing %s", moduleName);
624            throw new MacroExecutionException(message, checkstyleException);
625        }
626    }
627
628    /**
629     * Get a set of properties for the given class.
630     *
631     * @param clss the class to get the properties for.
632     * @return a set of properties for the given class.
633     */
634    public static Set<String> getProperties(Class<?> clss) {
635        final Set<String> result = new TreeSet<>();
636        final PropertyDescriptor[] propertyDescriptors = PropertyUtils.getPropertyDescriptors(clss);
637
638        for (PropertyDescriptor propertyDescriptor : propertyDescriptors) {
639            if (propertyDescriptor.getWriteMethod() != null) {
640                result.add(propertyDescriptor.getName());
641            }
642        }
643
644        return result;
645    }
646
647    /**
648     * Checks if the property is a global property. Global properties come from the base classes
649     * and are common to all checks. For example id, severity, tabWidth, etc.
650     *
651     * @param clss the class of the module.
652     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
653     * @return true if the property is a global property.
654     */
655    private static boolean isGlobalProperty(Class<?> clss, String propertyName) {
656        return AbstractCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)
657                    && CHECK_PROPERTIES.contains(propertyName)
658                || AbstractJavadocCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)
659                    && JAVADOC_CHECK_PROPERTIES.contains(propertyName)
660                || AbstractFileSetCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)
661                    && FILESET_PROPERTIES.contains(propertyName);
662    }
663
664    /**
665     * Checks if the property is supposed to be documented.
666     *
667     * @param clss the class of the module.
668     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
669     * @return true if the property is supposed to be documented.
670     */
671    private static boolean isUndocumentedProperty(Class<?> clss, String propertyName) {
672        return UNDOCUMENTED_PROPERTIES.contains(clss.getSimpleName() + DOT + propertyName);
673    }
674
675    /**
676     * Gets properties that are not explicitly captured but should be documented if
677     * certain conditions are met.
678     *
679     * @param instance the instance of the module.
680     * @param clss the class of the module.
681     * @return the non explicit properties.
682     */
683    private static Set<String> getNonExplicitProperties(
684            Object instance, Class<?> clss) {
685        final Set<String> result = new TreeSet<>();
686        if (AbstractCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)) {
687            final AbstractCheck check = (AbstractCheck) instance;
688
689            final int[] acceptableTokens = check.getAcceptableTokens();
690            Arrays.sort(acceptableTokens);
691            final int[] defaultTokens = check.getDefaultTokens();
692            Arrays.sort(defaultTokens);
693            final int[] requiredTokens = check.getRequiredTokens();
694            Arrays.sort(requiredTokens);
695
696            if (!Arrays.equals(acceptableTokens, defaultTokens)
697                    || !Arrays.equals(acceptableTokens, requiredTokens)) {
698                result.add(TOKENS);
699            }
700        }
701
702        if (AbstractJavadocCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)) {
703            final AbstractJavadocCheck check = (AbstractJavadocCheck) instance;
704            result.add("violateExecutionOnNonTightHtml");
705
706            final int[] acceptableJavadocTokens = check.getAcceptableJavadocTokens();
707            Arrays.sort(acceptableJavadocTokens);
708            final int[] defaultJavadocTokens = check.getDefaultJavadocTokens();
709            Arrays.sort(defaultJavadocTokens);
710            final int[] requiredJavadocTokens = check.getRequiredJavadocTokens();
711            Arrays.sort(requiredJavadocTokens);
712
713            if (!Arrays.equals(acceptableJavadocTokens, defaultJavadocTokens)
714                    || !Arrays.equals(acceptableJavadocTokens, requiredJavadocTokens)) {
715                result.add(JAVADOC_TOKENS);
716            }
717        }
718
719        if (AbstractFileSetCheck.class.isAssignableFrom(clss)) {
720            result.add(FILE_EXTENSIONS);
721        }
722        return result;
723    }
724
725    /**
726     * Get the description of the property.
727     *
728     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
729     * @param javadoc the Javadoc of the property setter method.
730     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
731     * @return the description of the property.
732     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the description could not be extracted.
733     */
734    public static String getPropertyDescription(
735            String propertyName, DetailNode javadoc, String moduleName)
736            throws MacroExecutionException {
737        final String description;
738        if (TOKENS.equals(propertyName)) {
739            description = "tokens to check";
740        }
741        else if (JAVADOC_TOKENS.equals(propertyName)) {
742            description = "javadoc tokens to check";
743        }
744        else {
745            final String descriptionString = SETTER_PATTERN.matcher(
746                    DescriptionExtractor.getDescriptionFromJavadoc(javadoc, moduleName))
747                    .replaceFirst("");
748
749            final String firstLetterCapitalized = descriptionString.substring(0, 1)
750                    .toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT);
751            description = firstLetterCapitalized + descriptionString.substring(1);
752        }
753        return description;
754    }
755
756    /**
757     * Get the since version of the property.
758     *
759     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
760     * @param moduleJavadoc the Javadoc of the module.
761     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
762     * @param propertyJavadoc the Javadoc of the property setter method.
763     * @return the since version of the property.
764     * @throws MacroExecutionException if the module since version could not be extracted.
765     */
766    public static String getSinceVersion(String moduleName, DetailNode moduleJavadoc,
767                                         String propertyName, DetailNode propertyJavadoc)
768            throws MacroExecutionException {
769        final String sinceVersion;
770
771        final String hardCodedPropertyVersion = SINCE_VERSION_FOR_INHERITED_PROPERTY.get(
772            moduleName + DOT + propertyName);
773
774        if (hardCodedPropertyVersion != null) {
775            sinceVersion = hardCodedPropertyVersion;
776        }
777        else {
778            final String moduleSince = getSinceVersionFromJavadoc(moduleJavadoc);
779
780            if (moduleSince == null) {
781                throw new MacroExecutionException(
782                        "Missing @since on module " + moduleName);
783            }
784
785            String propertySince = null;
786            if (propertyJavadoc != null) {
787                propertySince = getSinceVersionFromJavadoc(propertyJavadoc);
788            }
789
790            if (propertySince != null && isVersionAtLeast(propertySince, moduleSince)) {
791                sinceVersion = propertySince;
792            }
793            else {
794                sinceVersion = moduleSince;
795            }
796        }
797
798        return sinceVersion;
799    }
800
801    /**
802     * Extract the since version from the Javadoc.
803     *
804     * @param javadoc the Javadoc to extract the since version from.
805     * @return the since version of the setter.
806     */
807    @Nullable
808    private static String getSinceVersionFromJavadoc(DetailNode javadoc) {
809        final DetailNode sinceJavadocTag = getSinceJavadocTag(javadoc);
810        return Optional.ofNullable(sinceJavadocTag)
811            .map(tag -> JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(tag, JavadocTokenTypes.DESCRIPTION))
812            .map(description -> JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(description, JavadocTokenTypes.TEXT))
813            .map(DetailNode::getText)
814            .orElse(null);
815    }
816
817    /**
818     * Find the since Javadoc tag node in the given Javadoc.
819     *
820     * @param javadoc the Javadoc to search.
821     * @return the since Javadoc tag node or null if not found.
822     */
823    private static DetailNode getSinceJavadocTag(DetailNode javadoc) {
824        final DetailNode[] children = javadoc.getChildren();
825        DetailNode javadocTagWithSince = null;
826        for (final DetailNode child : children) {
827            if (child.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.JAVADOC_TAG) {
828                final DetailNode sinceNode = JavadocUtil.findFirstToken(
829                        child, JavadocTokenTypes.SINCE_LITERAL);
830                if (sinceNode != null) {
831                    javadocTagWithSince = child;
832                    break;
833                }
834            }
835        }
836        return javadocTagWithSince;
837    }
838
839    /**
840     * Returns {@code true} if {@code actualVersion} ≥ {@code requiredVersion}.
841     * Both versions have any trailing "-SNAPSHOT" stripped before comparison.
842     *
843     * @param actualVersion   e.g. "8.3" or "8.3-SNAPSHOT"
844     * @param requiredVersion e.g. "8.3"
845     * @return {@code true} if actualVersion exists, and, numerically, is at least requiredVersion
846     */
847    private static boolean isVersionAtLeast(String actualVersion,
848                                            String requiredVersion) {
849        final Version actualVersionParsed = Version.parse(actualVersion);
850        final Version requiredVersionParsed = Version.parse(requiredVersion);
851
852        return actualVersionParsed.compareTo(requiredVersionParsed) >= 0;
853    }
854
855    /**
856     * Get the type of the property.
857     *
858     * @param field the field to get the type of.
859     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
860     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
861     * @param instance the instance of the module.
862     * @return the type of the property.
863     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the type.
864     */
865    public static String getType(Field field, String propertyName,
866                                 String moduleName, Object instance)
867            throws MacroExecutionException {
868        final Class<?> fieldClass = getFieldClass(field, propertyName, moduleName, instance);
869        return Optional.ofNullable(field)
870                .map(nonNullField -> nonNullField.getAnnotation(XdocsPropertyType.class))
871                .map(propertyType -> propertyType.value().getDescription())
872                .orElseGet(fieldClass::getSimpleName);
873    }
874
875    /**
876     * Get the default value of the property.
877     *
878     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
879     * @param field the field to get the default value of.
880     * @param classInstance the instance of the class to get the default value of.
881     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
882     * @return the default value of the property.
883     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the default value.
884     * @noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
885     * @noinspectionreason IfStatementWithTooManyBranches - complex nature of getting properties
886     *      from XML files requires giant if/else statement
887     */
888    // -@cs[CyclomaticComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable
889    public static String getDefaultValue(String propertyName, Field field,
890                                         Object classInstance, String moduleName)
891            throws MacroExecutionException {
892        final Object value = getFieldValue(field, classInstance);
893        final Class<?> fieldClass = getFieldClass(field, propertyName, moduleName, classInstance);
894        String result = null;
895        if (CHARSET.equals(propertyName)) {
896            result = "the charset property of the parent"
897                    + " <a href=\"https://checkstyle.org/config.html#Checker\">Checker</a> module";
898        }
899        else if (classInstance instanceof PropertyCacheFile) {
900            result = "null (no cache file)";
901        }
902        else if (fieldClass == boolean.class) {
903            result = value.toString();
904        }
905        else if (fieldClass == int.class) {
906            result = value.toString();
907        }
908        else if (fieldClass == int[].class) {
909            result = getIntArrayPropertyValue(value);
910        }
911        else if (fieldClass == double[].class) {
912            result = removeSquareBrackets(Arrays.toString((double[]) value).replace(".0", ""));
913            if (result.isEmpty()) {
914                result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
915            }
916        }
917        else if (fieldClass == String[].class) {
918            result = getStringArrayPropertyValue(propertyName, value);
919        }
920        else if (fieldClass == URI.class || fieldClass == String.class) {
921            if (value != null) {
922                result = '"' + value.toString() + '"';
923            }
924        }
925        else if (fieldClass == Pattern.class) {
926            if (value != null) {
927                result = '"' + value.toString().replace("\n", "\\n").replace("\t", "\\t")
928                        .replace("\r", "\\r").replace("\f", "\\f") + '"';
929            }
930        }
931        else if (fieldClass == Pattern[].class) {
932            result = getPatternArrayPropertyValue(value);
933        }
934        else if (fieldClass.isEnum()) {
935            if (value != null) {
936                result = value.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ENGLISH);
937            }
938        }
939        else if (fieldClass == AccessModifierOption[].class) {
940            result = removeSquareBrackets(Arrays.toString((Object[]) value));
941        }
942        else {
943            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT,
944                    "Unknown property type: %s", fieldClass.getSimpleName());
945            throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
946        }
947
948        if (result == null) {
949            result = "null";
950        }
951
952        return result;
953    }
954
955    /**
956     * Gets the name of the bean property's default value for the Pattern array class.
957     *
958     * @param fieldValue The bean property's value
959     * @return String form of property's default value
960     */
961    private static String getPatternArrayPropertyValue(Object fieldValue) {
962        Object value = fieldValue;
963        if (value instanceof Collection) {
964            final Collection<?> collection = (Collection<?>) value;
965
966            value = collection.stream()
967                    .map(Pattern.class::cast)
968                    .toArray(Pattern[]::new);
969        }
970
971        String result = "";
972        if (value != null && Array.getLength(value) > 0) {
973            result = removeSquareBrackets(
974                    Arrays.stream((Pattern[]) value)
975                    .map(Pattern::pattern)
976                    .collect(Collectors.joining(COMMA_SPACE)));
977        }
978
979        if (result.isEmpty()) {
980            result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
981        }
982        return result;
983    }
984
985    /**
986     * Removes square brackets [ and ] from the given string.
987     *
988     * @param value the string to remove square brackets from.
989     * @return the string without square brackets.
990     */
991    private static String removeSquareBrackets(String value) {
992        return value
993                .replace("[", "")
994                .replace("]", "");
995    }
996
997    /**
998     * Gets the name of the bean property's default value for the string array class.
999     *
1000     * @param propertyName The bean property's name
1001     * @param value The bean property's value
1002     * @return String form of property's default value
1003     */
1004    private static String getStringArrayPropertyValue(String propertyName, Object value) {
1005        String result;
1006        if (value == null) {
1007            result = "";
1008        }
1009        else {
1010            try (Stream<?> valuesStream = getValuesStream(value)) {
1011                result = valuesStream
1012                    .map(String.class::cast)
1013                    .sorted()
1014                    .collect(Collectors.joining(COMMA_SPACE));
1015            }
1016        }
1017
1018        if (result.isEmpty()) {
1019            if (FILE_EXTENSIONS.equals(propertyName)) {
1020                result = "all files";
1021            }
1022            else {
1023                result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
1024            }
1025        }
1026        return result;
1027    }
1028
1029    /**
1030     * Generates a stream of values from the given value.
1031     *
1032     * @param value the value to generate the stream from.
1033     * @return the stream of values.
1034     */
1035    private static Stream<?> getValuesStream(Object value) {
1036        final Stream<?> valuesStream;
1037        if (value instanceof Collection) {
1038            final Collection<?> collection = (Collection<?>) value;
1039            valuesStream = collection.stream();
1040        }
1041        else {
1042            final Object[] array = (Object[]) value;
1043            valuesStream = Arrays.stream(array);
1044        }
1045        return valuesStream;
1046    }
1047
1048    /**
1049     * Returns the name of the bean property's default value for the int array class.
1050     *
1051     * @param value The bean property's value.
1052     * @return String form of property's default value.
1053     */
1054    private static String getIntArrayPropertyValue(Object value) {
1055        try (IntStream stream = getIntStream(value)) {
1056            String result = stream
1057                    .mapToObj(TokenUtil::getTokenName)
1058                    .sorted()
1059                    .collect(Collectors.joining(COMMA_SPACE));
1060            if (result.isEmpty()) {
1061                result = CURLY_BRACKETS;
1062            }
1063            return result;
1064        }
1065    }
1066
1067    /**
1068     * Get the int stream from the given value.
1069     *
1070     * @param value the value to get the int stream from.
1071     * @return the int stream.
1072     */
1073    private static IntStream getIntStream(Object value) {
1074        final IntStream stream;
1075        if (value instanceof Collection) {
1076            final Collection<?> collection = (Collection<?>) value;
1077            stream = collection.stream()
1078                    .mapToInt(int.class::cast);
1079        }
1080        else if (value instanceof BitSet) {
1081            stream = ((BitSet) value).stream();
1082        }
1083        else {
1084            stream = Arrays.stream((int[]) value);
1085        }
1086        return stream;
1087    }
1088
1089    /**
1090     * Gets the class of the given field.
1091     *
1092     * @param field the field to get the class of.
1093     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
1094     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1095     * @param instance the instance of the module.
1096     * @return the class of the field.
1097     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the class.
1098     */
1099    // -@cs[CyclomaticComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable
1100    private static Class<?> getFieldClass(Field field, String propertyName,
1101                                          String moduleName, Object instance)
1102            throws MacroExecutionException {
1103        Class<?> result = null;
1104
1105        if (PROPERTIES_ALLOWED_GET_TYPES_FROM_METHOD
1106                .contains(moduleName + DOT + propertyName)) {
1107            result = getPropertyClass(propertyName, instance);
1108        }
1109        if (field != null && result == null) {
1110            result = field.getType();
1111        }
1112        if (result == null) {
1113            throw new MacroExecutionException(
1114                    "Could not find field " + propertyName + " in class " + moduleName);
1115        }
1116        if (field != null && (result == List.class || result == Set.class)) {
1117            final ParameterizedType type = (ParameterizedType) field.getGenericType();
1118            final Class<?> parameterClass = (Class<?>) type.getActualTypeArguments()[0];
1119
1120            if (parameterClass == Integer.class) {
1121                result = int[].class;
1122            }
1123            else if (parameterClass == String.class) {
1124                result = String[].class;
1125            }
1126            else if (parameterClass == Pattern.class) {
1127                result = Pattern[].class;
1128            }
1129            else {
1130                final String message = "Unknown parameterized type: "
1131                        + parameterClass.getSimpleName();
1132                throw new MacroExecutionException(message);
1133            }
1134        }
1135        else if (result == BitSet.class) {
1136            result = int[].class;
1137        }
1138
1139        return result;
1140    }
1141
1142    /**
1143     * Gets the class of the given java property.
1144     *
1145     * @param propertyName the name of the property.
1146     * @param instance the instance of the module.
1147     * @return the class of the java property.
1148     * @throws MacroExecutionException if an error occurs during getting the class.
1149     */
1150    // -@cs[ForbidWildcardAsReturnType] Object is received as param, no prediction on type of field
1151    public static Class<?> getPropertyClass(String propertyName, Object instance)
1152            throws MacroExecutionException {
1153        final Class<?> result;
1154        try {
1155            final PropertyDescriptor descriptor = PropertyUtils.getPropertyDescriptor(instance,
1156                    propertyName);
1157            result = descriptor.getPropertyType();
1158        }
1159        catch (IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException exc) {
1160            throw new MacroExecutionException(exc.getMessage(), exc);
1161        }
1162        return result;
1163    }
1164
1165    /**
1166     * Get the difference between two lists of tokens.
1167     *
1168     * @param tokens the list of tokens to remove from.
1169     * @param subtractions the tokens to remove.
1170     * @return the difference between the two lists.
1171     */
1172    public static List<Integer> getDifference(int[] tokens, int... subtractions) {
1173        final Set<Integer> subtractionsSet = Arrays.stream(subtractions)
1174                .boxed()
1175                .collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableSet());
1176        return Arrays.stream(tokens)
1177                .boxed()
1178                .filter(token -> !subtractionsSet.contains(token))
1179                .collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableList());
1180    }
1181
1182    /**
1183     * Gets the field with the given name from the given class.
1184     *
1185     * @param fieldClass the class to get the field from.
1186     * @param propertyName the name of the field.
1187     * @return the field we are looking for.
1188     */
1189    public static Field getField(Class<?> fieldClass, String propertyName) {
1190        Field result = null;
1191        Class<?> currentClass = fieldClass;
1192
1193        while (!Object.class.equals(currentClass)) {
1194            try {
1195                result = currentClass.getDeclaredField(propertyName);
1196                result.trySetAccessible();
1197                break;
1198            }
1199            catch (NoSuchFieldException ignored) {
1200                currentClass = currentClass.getSuperclass();
1201            }
1202        }
1203
1204        return result;
1205    }
1206
1207    /**
1208     * Constructs string with relative link to the provided document.
1209     *
1210     * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1211     * @param document the path of the document.
1212     * @return relative link to the document.
1213     * @throws MacroExecutionException if link to the document cannot be constructed.
1214     */
1215    public static String getLinkToDocument(String moduleName, String document)
1216            throws MacroExecutionException {
1217        final Path templatePath = getTemplatePath(moduleName.replace("Check", ""));
1218        if (templatePath == null) {
1219            throw new MacroExecutionException(
1220                    String.format(Locale.ROOT,
1221                            "Could not find template for %s", moduleName));
1222        }
1223        final Path templatePathParent = templatePath.getParent();
1224        if (templatePathParent == null) {
1225            throw new MacroExecutionException("Failed to get parent path for " + templatePath);
1226        }
1227        return templatePathParent
1228                .relativize(Path.of(SRC, "site/xdoc", document))
1229                .toString()
1230                .replace(".xml", ".html")
1231                .replace('\\', '/');
1232    }
1233
1234    /** Utility class for extracting description from a method's Javadoc. */
1235    private static final class DescriptionExtractor {
1236
1237        /**
1238         * Extracts the description from the javadoc detail node. Performs a DFS traversal on the
1239         * detail node and extracts the text nodes.
1240         *
1241         * @param javadoc the Javadoc to extract the description from.
1242         * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1243         * @return the description of the setter.
1244         * @throws MacroExecutionException if the description could not be extracted.
1245         * @noinspection TooBroadScope
1246         * @noinspectionreason TooBroadScope - complex nature of method requires large scope
1247         */
1248        // -@cs[NPathComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable
1249        // -@cs[CyclomaticComplexity] Splitting would not make the code more readable.
1250        private static String getDescriptionFromJavadoc(DetailNode javadoc, String moduleName)
1251                throws MacroExecutionException {
1252            boolean isInCodeLiteral = false;
1253            boolean isInHtmlElement = false;
1254            boolean isInHrefAttribute = false;
1255            final StringBuilder description = new StringBuilder(128);
1256            final Deque<DetailNode> queue = new ArrayDeque<>();
1257            final List<DetailNode> descriptionNodes = getDescriptionNodes(javadoc);
1258            Lists.reverse(descriptionNodes).forEach(queue::push);
1259
1260            // Perform DFS traversal on description nodes
1261            while (!queue.isEmpty()) {
1262                final DetailNode node = queue.pop();
1263                Lists.reverse(Arrays.asList(node.getChildren())).forEach(queue::push);
1264
1265                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_TAG_NAME
1266                        && "href".equals(node.getText())) {
1267                    isInHrefAttribute = true;
1268                }
1269                if (isInHrefAttribute && node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.ATTR_VALUE) {
1270                    final String href = node.getText();
1271                    if (href.contains(CHECKSTYLE_ORG_URL)) {
1272                        handleInternalLink(description, moduleName, href);
1273                    }
1274                    else {
1275                        description.append(href);
1276                    }
1277
1278                    isInHrefAttribute = false;
1279                    continue;
1280                }
1281                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT) {
1282                    isInHtmlElement = true;
1283                }
1284                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.END
1285                        && node.getParent().getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.HTML_ELEMENT_END) {
1286                    description.append(node.getText());
1287                    isInHtmlElement = false;
1288                }
1289                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.TEXT
1290                        // If a node has children, its text is not part of the description
1291                        || isInHtmlElement && node.getChildren().length == 0
1292                            // Some HTML elements span multiple lines, so we avoid the asterisk
1293                            && node.getType() != JavadocTokenTypes.LEADING_ASTERISK) {
1294                    description.append(node.getText());
1295                }
1296                if (node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.CODE_LITERAL) {
1297                    isInCodeLiteral = true;
1298                    description.append("<code>");
1299                }
1300                if (isInCodeLiteral
1301                        && node.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.JAVADOC_INLINE_TAG_END) {
1302                    isInCodeLiteral = false;
1303                    description.append("</code>");
1304                }
1305            }
1306            return description.toString().trim();
1307        }
1308
1309        /**
1310         * Converts the href value to a relative link to the document and appends it to the
1311         * description.
1312         *
1313         * @param description the description to append the relative link to.
1314         * @param moduleName the name of the module.
1315         * @param value the href value.
1316         * @throws MacroExecutionException if the relative link could not be created.
1317         */
1318        private static void handleInternalLink(StringBuilder description,
1319                                               String moduleName, String value)
1320                throws MacroExecutionException {
1321            String href = value;
1322            href = href.replace(CHECKSTYLE_ORG_URL, "");
1323            // Remove first and last characters, they are always double quotes
1324            href = href.substring(1, href.length() - 1);
1325
1326            final String relativeHref = getLinkToDocument(moduleName, href);
1327            final char doubleQuote = '\"';
1328            description.append(doubleQuote).append(relativeHref).append(doubleQuote);
1329        }
1330
1331        /**
1332         * Extracts description nodes from javadoc.
1333         *
1334         * @param javadoc the Javadoc to extract the description from.
1335         * @return the description nodes of the setter.
1336         */
1337        private static List<DetailNode> getDescriptionNodes(DetailNode javadoc) {
1338            final DetailNode[] children = javadoc.getChildren();
1339            final List<DetailNode> descriptionNodes = new ArrayList<>();
1340            for (final DetailNode child : children) {
1341                if (isEndOfDescription(child)) {
1342                    break;
1343                }
1344                descriptionNodes.add(child);
1345            }
1346            return descriptionNodes;
1347        }
1348
1349        /**
1350         * Determines if the given child index is the end of the description. The end of the
1351         * description is defined as 4 consecutive nodes of type NEWLINE, LEADING_ASTERISK, NEWLINE,
1352         * LEADING_ASTERISK. This is an asterisk that is alone on a line. Just like the one below
1353         * this line.
1354         *
1355         * @param child the child to check.
1356         * @return true if the given child index is the end of the description.
1357         */
1358        private static boolean isEndOfDescription(DetailNode child) {
1359            final DetailNode nextSibling = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(child);
1360            final DetailNode secondNextSibling = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(nextSibling);
1361            final DetailNode thirdNextSibling = JavadocUtil.getNextSibling(secondNextSibling);
1362
1363            return child.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.NEWLINE
1364                        && nextSibling.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.LEADING_ASTERISK
1365                        && secondNextSibling.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.NEWLINE
1366                        && thirdNextSibling.getType() == JavadocTokenTypes.LEADING_ASTERISK;
1367        }
1368    }
1369}
